author: pk910
content:
@lodestar
some lodestar nodes on devnet-3 seem to be stuck in a download loop.
the logs show that they're repeately trying to download the columns for the same slots from the same lighthouse clients, which always gets rejected due to a column mismatch (lighthouse replies too many columns):
```
Aug-26 09:25:55.499[sync]          verbose: Batch download error id=Head-399, startEpoch=6700, status=Downloading, peer=16...J1cxah - Missing or mismatching dataColumnSidecars from peerId=16Uiu2HAmLyapMNMX9gRSZX3cMm58snMiyYfKSUu7ZzQDHkJ1cxah for blockSlot=214401 blobKzgCommitmentsLen=1 with numColumns=128 dataColumnSidecars=9 requestedColumnsPresent=true received dataColumnIndexes=76 99 101 86 57 124 9 45 13 requested=9 57 86 99 101 124
Aug-26 09:25:56.207[sync]          verbose: Batch download error id=Head-399, startEpoch=6701, status=Downloading, peer=16...GMgg5g - Missing or mismatching dataColumnSidecars from peerId=16Uiu2HAmBgxVVruzkgaBQBN2KCKY9Jz5QqYK1jyVGbg8QSGMgg5g for blockSlot=214434 blobKzgCommitmentsLen=20 with numColumns=128 dataColumnSidecars=9 requestedColumnsPresent=true received dataColumnIndexes=115 110 122 82 41 2 8 67 113 requested=2 8 41 67 82 110 115 122
Aug-26 09:25:56.917[sync]          verbose: Batch download error id=Head-399, startEpoch=6699, status=Downloading, peer=16...J1cxah - Missing or mismatching dataColumnSidecars from peerId=16Uiu2HAmLyapMNMX9gRSZX3cMm58snMiyYfKSUu7ZzQDHkJ1cxah for blockSlot=214375 blobKzgCommitmentsLen=20 with numColumns=128 dataColumnSidecars=9 requestedColumnsPresent=true received dataColumnIndexes=76 99 101 86 57 124 9 45 13 requested=9 57 86 99 101 124
```

so besides of lighthouse serving the wrong columns, we'd expect lodestar to give up doing the same request over and over again and continue syncing with another client.. but it's stuck for hours, repeating the same log lines.
see lodestar-geth-1 node for more details ðŸ™‚

author: agnxsh
content: We are prioritising the trunk branch at the moment, thatâ€™s our first priority, also better column syncing, so yeah not really very engaged debugging

author: manunlp
content: We noticed several bugs on Prysm regarding syncing from a checkpoint in an unfinalized network. Some bug are fixed, some are not. We achieved to sync a super node on the devnet (from local computer) successfully . `prysm-nethermind-1`  supernode is on a good way to sync as well. If it works well, I'll wipe all other Prysm nodes except one and they should sync. (All except one to keep one node that has the syncing bug.)

author: philngo
content: We have several syncing + performance issues we're investigating now since non-finality and attempting to fix. Including the download loop mentioned above, some block processing issues and performance issues coming from getBlobsV2 and gossip verificationfor DataColumnSidecar.
